thread.title: What to do in Milwaukee this weekend
thread.title_full: What to do in Milwaukee this weekend

title: What to do in Milwaukee this weekend
text:
What to do in Milwaukee this weekend By Chris Foran of the Journal Sentinel Oct. 16, 2015 7:00 a.m. (0) Comments 
The Best of Brew City is your mobile guide to going out in Milwaukee. Visit jsonline.com/brewcity and download the app for iOS or Android today. 
The Forest County Potawatomi's annual Hunting Moon Pow Wow makes camp at the UW-Milwaukee Panther Arena Friday through Sunday. Hundreds of dancers and more than 20 drum groups from throughout the United States are expected to perform this year, in pursuit of nearly $100,000 in prize money. Native American foods and crafts also will be available. Doors open at the arena at 3 p.m. Friday, with Grand Entry at 6 p.m.; Saturday, the doors open at 10 a.m. and Grand Entry is at 1 p.m., while the doors open at 10 a.m. Sunday and Grand Entry at noon. The Pow Wow is free and open to the public. 
Info: huntingmoonpowwow.com 
It's hard to believe that it's just the first Cupcake Fest MKE . What's being called Milwaukee's first cupcake festival — Saturday from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. at the Mitchell Park Domes, 524 S. Layton Blvd. — will include an interactive cupcake factory, cake decorating of a 6-foot-tall display cake, a craft fair and more. Admission is included in regular Domes admission: $7; $5 for Milwaukee County seniors with ID, people with disabilities, students with ID and kids ages 6 to 17; free for children 5 and younger. 
Info: CupcakeFestMKE.com 
Legos, Legos everywhere — or at least, everywhere in the Wisconsin Exposition Center at State Fair Park, 8200 W. Greenfield Ave., West Allis, at Brick Fest Live Lego Fan Festival , 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. and 3 to 7 p.m. Saturday and Sunday. Admission is $22. © 2015 , Journal Sentinel Inc. All rights reserved. About Chris Foran 
Chris Foran is an assistant entertainment editor, overseeing the Tap Weekend, Tap Daily, Good Morning and TV Cue sections. He also writes about movies, books, pop culture and fun stuff to do in Milwaukee.
